content.question: Let f be the function with derivative given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@470E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. On what interval is f decreasing?

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
